results.title: Fire into gold
results.creator_credit: Katie Jennings and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fire on the rim”.
The lands around the “ring of fire” have long attracted people by their beauty, natural riches and promise of great wealth, despite the perilious threat of natural disaster. In Bali, volcanoes have created fertile lands, whereas in Papua New Guinea, centuries of activity have resulted in a gold mountain, the richest mine in the world. In contrast, the movement of the earth’s plates have resulted in the geothermic pools and geysers in New Zealand, which have become popular tourist attractions, as have the famous volcanoes of Hawaii.

results.title: The Nature & nurture of development: Pt II
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 24 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Shows how development always occurs in context and that time and place are important in child development, together with biology. This program considers childhood rites of passage and acculturisation. It also presents a review of topics such as mental agility, physical growth, language and personality development.
results.title_for_label: The Nature & nurture of development: Pt II

results.title: The Nature & nurture of development:Pt I
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 23 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Shows how development always occurs in context and that time and place are important in child development, together with biology. This program examines what has been learnt from recent research and considers moral development and the effects of environment in the nature/nurture controversy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Family stress: the child's perspective
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 22 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Examines the social and economic forces that alter families and increase risks for children. Reviews research results on the effects of divorce on children, observing a Russian family on the brink of divorce. The determinants and outcomes of teen pregnancy are discussed with American teen mothers and mothers-to-be.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Poverty, child health & child labour
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 21 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Explores the socioeconomic factors that have historically played a powerful role in children’s lives, and contrasts the decline in infant/child mortality and child labour in industrialised societies. Child labour in Guatemala provides one of several examples of the harsh economic circumstances in which many children still live.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Risk & resilience
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Examines the tension between risk and resilience and looks at specific developmental risks and the social, family interactional and person variables associated with resilience. The lessons of classic studies and contemporary projects across America are examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Adolescence: the prolonged transition
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Through historical and cross-cultural comparisons, the extent to which the concept of adolescence as a period of increased autonomy, identity development, and risk-taking, is a social construction, is examined. The biological aspects of puberty and emerging sexuality are addressed. Observes examples of adolescents in transition from family to a broader adult world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Peer culture
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Explores two worlds children must negotiate during middle childhood and adolescence; the authority of adults and the co-operation of peers. The nature of the peer group as a microsociety is analysed through a look at “los abandonados”, a homeless and parentless group of children in Guatemala City who live in a completely peer-organized world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS

results.title: Learning & achievement
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
The role that learning plays in the lives of children, the functions of schooling and children’s orientation toward mastery and achievement are addressed as events surrounding the child’s first day of school in Japan, Russia, Brazil and the U.S. are observed. Discusses variables that enhance learning and promote competence.
